snippet: The attack in the Sinai Peninsula has forced an inexperienced leader to confront competing interests to bring the situation under control.
abstract: Editorial warns that Egypt must act to prevent continued lawlessness in the Sinai Peninsula or risk compounding an already fragile situation that could conceivably unravel the 1979 Egypt-Israel peace treaty; maintains that Egyptian Pres Mohamed Morsi must confront competing interests to bring Sinai under control.
lead_paragraph: The attack in the Sinai Peninsula has forced an inexperienced leader to confront competing interests to bring the situation under control.
